entry.title: Binance Vs. CFTC Showdown: Court Sets Next Deadlines
entry.summary:

Binance Vs. CFTC: Here‚Äôs What‚Äôs Next
According to a minute entry before the Honorable Manish S. Shah, the court has mandated specific timelines for both parties involved. The defendants, Binance, CEO Changpeng ‚ÄúCZ‚Äù Zhao, and former chief compliance officer Samuel Lim, are expected to file their motions to dismiss the lawsuit by July 27, 2023.

entry.title: Judge Contemplates Jailing Sam Bankman-Fried Ahead of Fraud Trial
entry.summary: The judge presiding over the criminal charges against Sam Bankman-Fried has restricted him from communicating publicly on Wednesday. The judge is considering jailing him for allegations of witness tampering before the trial over the collapse of FTX begins. This decision was arrived at after Sam Bankman-Fried reportedly shared personal writings of Caroline Ellison, his former girlfriend and the former Chief Executive Officer of Alameda Research, with a journalist. According to the prosecutors, by sharing Ellison's writings, Bankman-Fried had violated the terms of his bail. SBF Is Accused of Intimidating Witnesses Ellison is a key witness who is expected to testify against Bankman-Fried when he stands trial in October. Alongside two of FTX's former executives, Gary Wang an‚Ä¶

entry.title: Binance to Restore Full Services in Japan in August, CZ Unveils
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrency exchange Binance will start offering full services in Japan next month, founder Changpeng Zhao (CZ) announced. The leading trading venue for digital assets reenters the Japanese market with a domestic exchange after announcing earlier it was discontinuing services through its global platform.
Binance Returns to Japan, Praises Its Web3 Regulatory Framework
The world‚Äôs largest crypto exchange by daily trading volume, Binance, will provide full services on its new platform in Japan starting from August, its founder and CEO Changpeng Zhao revealed in a virtual address to the participants in the Webx conference in Tokyo on Tuesday.
CZ: Japan is a flagship leader for Web3 regulatory environments.
Earlier today, @cz_binance virtually addressed the WebX conference in Japan‚Ä¶

entry.title: Landmark Victory: US Congress Committee Passes Historic Crypto Bill
entry.summary:
In a landmark victory for the crypto industry, the US House Financial Services Committee has achieved a landmark victory by advancing a bipartisan bill aimed at establishing a regulatory framework for Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies yesterday. The bill‚Äôs passage marks Capitol Hill‚Äôs efforts to codify federal oversight for the digital asset industry, providing much-needed clarity and regulation for investors and the industry alike.
Landmark Regulation For The US Crypto Industry
The crypto industry has been under intense scrutiny since investors faced substantial losses last year due to sudden collapses of prominent companies like Celsius, Voyager and FTX. The bill passed by the House Financial Services Committee sets out to define whether a cryptocurrency should be classified as a security‚Ä¶

entry.title: Over 10,000 South African Retail Outlets Now Accept Momint Crypto Vouchers
entry.summary:
Momint, a Web3 marketplace app, has said South African residents can now use cryptocurrency to purchase shopping vouchers which are accepted by over 10,000 retailers. The Momint app can also be used to send cross-border remittances at a fraction of the fees charged by regular money transfer companies.
Vouchers Accepted by Popular Businesses
Momint, a Web3 marketplace, has launched a blockchain wallet which allows South African residents to purchase a shopping voucher with cryptocurrency, a report has said. Holders of the voucher can make payments at over 10,000 retail outlets across the African country.
According to a Mybroadband report, South Africa‚Äôs retail giants such as Checkers, Woolworths, Engen, and Takealot are some of the outlets that accept the Momint vouchers. The report added that the voucher is also accepted at some 5,000 international retailers.
In comments following the announcement, Momint CEO Ahren Posthumus also revealed that South Africans outside the formal economy can use the Web3 app to make everyday payments. Posthumus further explained why Momint proceeded to make it possible for South Africans to use crypto for regular payments.
‚ÄúThe new South African crypto asset digital regulation is laying the groundwork to protect investors and consumers to make sure businesses are acting ethically in this space. And that is also unlocking this potential for us to use the technology for much cheaper transaction costs, transacting with one another without going through a bank,‚Äù the Momint CEO said.
In addition to payments, the Momint app can be used to send cross-border remittances at a fraction of the fees charged by regular money transfer companies.
Register your email here to get a weekly update on African news sent to your inbox:
What are your thoughts on this story? Let us know what you think in the comments section below.

entry.title: SEC Forces Quantstamp To Refund Investors In $28 Million ICO Settlement
entry.summary:
Blockchain security firm Quantstamp has settled with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) over charges related to an unauthorized initial coin offering (ICO) that raised $28 million in 2017.
The SEC filed charges against the San Francisco-based firm for allegedly conducting an unregistered ICO of crypto asset securities, resulting in a settlement that requires Quantstamp to refund the ICO proceeds.¬†
As a result, the company has agreed to pay a disgorgement of $1,979,201, prejudgment interest of $494,314, and a civil penalty of $1 million.
Quantstamp Settles With SEC Over Regulatory Violations
According to the SEC‚Äôs complaint, Quantstamp raised over $28 million by selling ‚ÄúQSP‚Äù tokens to around 5,000 investors, including investors in the United States, in October and No‚Ä¶

entry.title: Binance Terminates German Crypto License Application As European Troubles Continue
entry.summary:
Prominent cryptocurrency exchange Binance has canceled its application for a crypto license in Germany as regulatory scrutiny on the exchange intensifies across the continent.
According to a report by Reuters, Binance withdrew its crypto custody license application only after the German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (BaFin) reportedly informed the exchange it would not approve the request.
However, in explaining the reasons behind this recent move, a Binance spokesman highlighted a shift in the worldwide market and regulatory conditions to Reuters.
In addition, the representative also laid out the exchange‚Äôs plans to still reapply for a crypto license in Germany.¬†
The spokesperson said:
Binance confirms it has proactively withdrawn its BaFin (Germany‚Äôs financial regu‚Ä¶

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead

It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcadia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed title‚Äîand made Crypto Unicorns instead.
